intro: Gymnanthes jacobinensis, commonly known as Jacobin's gymnanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Gymnanthes jacobinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
